appliesTo.title: Applies To
appliesTo.description: This section defines the region/locales/application information for where a search engine is available, and any specifics for that region/locale/application. If there are no entries in the list, it is considered to be included everywhere

telemetryId.title: Telemetry Id
telemetryId.description: The telemetry Id as used for some of SEARCH_COUNTS telemetry.

name.title: Name
name.description: The application this applies to (default/not specified is everywhere)

channel.title: Channel
channel.description: Which channel this belongs to (not set = everywhere). For ESR this is also keyed from the display version.

excludedDistributions.title: Excluded Distributions
excludedDistributions.description: Which distributions this does not apply to.

minVersion.title: Minimum Version
minVersion.description: The minimum version this applies to

maxVersion.title: Maxium Version
maxVersion.description: The maximum version this applies to (less-than comparison)

default.title: Default Status
default.description: Whether or not this engine should be default.

defaultPrivate.title: Default Status (PBM)
defaultPrivate.description: Whether or not this engine should be default in private browsing mode.

extraParams.title: Extra Parameters
extraParams.description: Extra parameters for the search engine (aka MozParams)

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the parameter that will be used in the search query

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: The type of parameter (pref or purpose)

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: The search purpose that triggers this parameter being appended.

value.title: Value
value.description: If this is a purpose type, the value is used as the value of the parameter in the query

pref.title: Preference name
pref.description: The preference name to get the value from (i.e. browser.search.param.<preference name>).

orderHint.title: Order Hint
orderHint.description: A hint to the display order (higher is a higer rank)

sapCodes.title: Search Access Point Codes
sapCodes.description: Codes for the search access points.

any.title: Any
any.description: SAP code that is used for all access points (overrides the others).

contextMenu.title: Context Menu
contextMenu.description: SAP code for searches from the context menu.

homePage.title: Home page
homePage.description: SAP code for searches from the home page.

keyword.title: Keyword
keyword.description: SAP code for searches via keywords.

newTab.title: New Tab
newTab.description: SAP code for searches from the new tab page.

searchBar.title: Search Bar
searchBar.description: SAP code for searches from the search bar.

searchUrlCodes.title: Codes
searchUrlCodes.description: A array of objects - map of parameter name to the parameter value.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the parameter that will be used in the query

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of parameter (pref or purpose)

params.title: Parameters
params.description: Various parameters for the search engines

suggestUrlGetParams.title: Suggestion URL GET Parameters
suggestUrlGetParams.description: Extra parameters for search suggestion URLs (e.g. 'pc=foo').

suggestUrlPostParams.title: Suggestion URL POST Parameters
suggestUrlPostParams.description: Extra parameters for search suggestion URLs (e.g. 'pc=foo').

telemetryId.title: Telemetry Id
telemetryId.description: The telemetry Id as used for some of SEARCH_COUNTS telemetry.

id.title: WebExtension Id
id.description: The identifier (local part) of the associated WebExtension should be of the format example@search.waterfox.net

locale.title: WebExtension Locale
locale.description: Overrides the WebExtension locales and specifies to use a particular one. Ideally this should only be used when really necessary, otherwise considered deprecated.

included.title: Included Locations
included.description: The locations to which this section applies. Note: Regions and Locales are 'and'ed together.

everywhere.title: Everywhere
everywhere.description: Set to true to signify that this is included everywhere.

excluded.title: Excluded Locations
excluded.description: The locations to which this section applies. Note: Regions and Locales are 'and'ed together.

experiment.title: Experiment
experiment.description: The experiment this section is associated with, if blank it is associate with any configuration.
